description: Dive into "Coastal Escapes: Kanyakumari's Beach Bliss" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Coastal Escapes: Kanyakumari's Beach Bliss

sources.snippet: The beach has a good number of tourist spots in its proximity which include Swami Vivekananda Memorial Rock, Lighthouse, Gandhi Mandapam, Kanyakumari Temple, Udayagiri Fort, and Padmanabhapuram Palace. However, the popular activities that can be enjoyed here are sightseeing and shopping. You can also take part in the festival which the place hosts like Kalabham, Navaratri, and Vaisakha.

The Kanyakumari Lighthouse, located atop a rocky promontory at the southernmost tip of India, offers panoramic views of the confluence of the Bay of Bengal, the Arabian Sea, and the Indian Ocean. Visi (Read More)tors can climb the spiral staircase to the top of the lighthouse for stunning vistas of the surrounding coastline and the vast expanse of the sea.

reviews.text:
Excellent view of Kanyakumari.

Better than any other location. Evening is the best time.

Free toilets and water also available.

Must see location in town.

It offers extraordinary views of the beach, city, and sunset, and they appreciate the minimal entry fee and convenient lift access to the top. They also highlight the well-maintained facilities, including restrooms and drinking water, and the polite staff

1. üóº Tall white and red lighthouse near the beach

2. ü™ú You can climb up using lift or stairs

3. üåä Top view shows sea, rock memorial, and town

4. üí® Wind was strong at the top

5. üì± Need to hold phone tightly while taking photos

6. üí∞ Entry fee ‚Çπ10 per person

7. üïí Open from 9‚ÄØAM to 1‚ÄØPM and 3‚ÄØPM to 5‚ÄØPM

8. üö∂ Located close to beach, easy to walk from there

places.generalDescription: Kanyakumari Beach, situated at the southernmost tip of the Indian Peninsula, offers breathtaking views of sunsets and moonrises over the confluence of three seas: the Indian Ocean, Bay of Bengal, and Arabian Sea. The rocky shoreline provides a picturesque setting for leisurely strolls while listening to the unique sound of waves. Visitors can savor local cuisine and explore nearby temples. It is best to visit during December and January to avoid extreme heat and humidity.

sources.snippet: The sound of waves you get to hear on this beach, you can‚Äôt find anywhere else. The place remains flooded with beach lovers every day. But swimming and surfing are not allowed here as the sea can be rough.
sources.shortName: Kanyakumari: An incredible beach town in Tamil Nadu

sources.snippet: Located in the southernmost part of India, Kanyakumari beach with its beautiful hue-changing beaches, the confluence of three water bodies: Bay of Bengal, Indian Ocean, and the Arabian Sea. Miraculously, here you can see that the water of three seas does not mix, you can distinguish between the turquoise blue, deep blue, and sea green waters of the three seas, though the colors keep changing with the season and the day's weather. The beach is not conducive to swim or surf as the water as the sea is rough and the beach is rocky.To enjoy the best view, you can visit the Triveni Sangam point and climb up the famous lighthouse watchtower to entirely take in its beauty.

Other major travel places at Kanyakumari include a host of beautiful beaches including Sothavilai Beach, Sanguthurai Beach and of course the main Kanyakumari Beach. Play with the waters of the ocean, take a stroll on the beaches as you witness the beautiful sun setting across the horizon-the beautiful beaches of Kanyakumari will always fill you with a sense of wonder. Away from the coastline Kanyakumari boasts of several other attractions for visiting including waterfalls, temples, churches, museums and historical monuments.
sources.shortName: Kanyakumari Tourism- Best Places to Visit in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: The Kanyakumari sunrise is the predominant reason why people come here. While sunrise at a beach is always splendid, there is something very magical about the sun‚Äôs first rays touching the waters of all the three oceans that surround the Indian Peninsula- the Bay of Bengal, the Indian Ocean and the Arabian Sea. The three distinct shades of the waters of the three oceans can be witnessed here and it is quite an experience.
sources.shortName: Beauty Sightseeing, Shopping & Best Time to Explore

sources.snippet: The best time to visit Kanyakumari Beach is in the winter season from October to February when the region experiences pleasant and calming climatic conditions. This is the peak season to visit the beach as the weather remains comfortable for outdoor activities. There are no adventure sports that take place here, however, tourists can spend quality time here and enjoy the bliss of the tranquil tourist destination.
sources.shortName: Kanyakumari Beach | Best Time to Visit

sources.snippet: Kanyakumari Amman Temple : A temple for Devi Kanyakumari, corresponding to the legend of the coastal city and its beach, has been built dedicated to the young and fiery goddess. The deity is smaller than any usual South Indian idol, but its diamond nose ring is said to be so bright and radiant that distant ships often mistake it for a lighthouse's beam of light.

Kanyakumari beach, located in the southernmost part of India, is the meeting point of three bodies of water - the Arabian Sea, the Indian Ocean, and the Bay of Bengal. Despite the fact that the water of these three bodies does not mix, you will be able to distinguish between their colours, though they change with the season and the weather of the day.
sources.shortName: 18 Beautiful Beaches in Tamil Nadu That You Should Visit

sources.snippet: Kanyakumari Beach, situated at the southernmost tip of India where the Arabian Sea, Bay of Bengal, and Indian Ocean meet, is a picturesque destination known for its stunning views of the sunrise and sunset. The beach is surrounded by rocky shores and has a vibrant atmosphere, attracting tourists from all over the world.
sources.shortName: Kanyakumari Beach Kanyakumari, India | Best Time To Visit Kanyakumari Beach

places.name: Kanyakumari Beach

reviews.text:
üì£Kanyakumari Amman Temple: 4:30 AM to 12:30 PM, and again from 4:00 PM to 8:00 PM.
Vivekananda Rock Memorial: 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM, with ferry services operating during those hours.
Padmanabhapuram Palace: 9:00 AM to 12:30 PM, and again from 2:00 PM to 4:30 PM.
Vattakottai Fort: 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM.

Boats to the Vivekananda Rock Memorial in Kanyakumari typically operate from 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM. The ferry ride takes about 30 minutes to reach the memorial.
The visiting timing of Saint Thiruvalluvar Statue is from 8 AM to 4 PM. The charge for ferry services from the shore to the statue are Rs. 20 per person

Pricing in Kanyakumari
Ferry Type	Price Range (INR)
Standard M2M Ferries	500 - 800
Luxury M2M Ferries	1500 - 2500
Roro Ferry	700 - 1200
Ajanta Ferry	600 - 1000

The best time to visit Kanyakumari is between October to February as the temperature during these months usually drops and ranges between 20-30 degree Celsius.

Kanyakumari is open to visitors throughout the day. Specific opening and closing times apply to various attractions, but the general rule is that the main sites are open from early morning until late afternoon/early evening.

The statue is built as per Indian architectural styles, and is hollow inside. However, tourists are allowed to climb only up to the foot of the statue. Along with the Vivekananda Rock Memorial, the statue attracts millions of tourists annually and is one of the must-visit spots in your trip to Tamil Nadu.

Watching the sunrise at Kanyakumari Beach is truly breathtaking ‚Äì a must-see experience. However, the beach gets extremely crowded on weekends, making it a bit difficult to enjoy peacefully. Unfortunately, the beach was quite unclean and dirty, which took away from the overall experience.

Kanyakumari Beach is a mesmerizing destination where the blue waters meet the land's edge. With the sea on three sides, it offers breathtaking views, making it a unique coastal experience. The beach is safe for bathing, allowing visitors to enjoy the refreshing waves. Changing rooms are available, ensuring convenience for travelers. As the southernmost tip of India, this location holds special significance and provides a spectacular horizon where the ocean seems endless. A must-visit spot for anyone seeking beauty and tranquility by the shore.

places.generalDescription: Chothavilai Beach, also known as Sothavilai Beach, is a top destination in Kanyakumari, located about 10 km from the city. With its 4km stretch of sandy shoreline, it's one of the longest beaches in Tamil Nadu. The beach offers shallow swimming waters and high sand dunes, making it a picturesque spot for beach lovers.
places.name: Chothavilai Beach

reviews.text:
The beach is a wonderful destination that offers a perfect blend of relaxation and adventure. The sound of waves crashing against the shore creates a calming atmosphere, while the sun shining down provides warmth and brightness to your day.

Sunsets at the beach are particularly stunning, with vibrant colors painting the sky as the sun dips below the horizon.

Overall, whether you're seeking peace and quiet or fun-filled activities, the beach is an ideal spot for everyone to enjoy.

And enjoy the aerial view of this beach

A tranquil beach, not bustling with tourists, but frequented by locals. So beach is not deserted, and there are some vendors for tea and coconut water, but remain clean and less crowded. A row of palm tree along the beach, with a few shade huts, provide good protection from sun, making this a perfect place to watch sunset

Place has ample parking for around 10 cars, but road is also empty, so more cars can be parked on road

A very calm and beautiful beach with good sandy shore. Warning sign shows that you should not bath here because it is steep. But you can stand at the shore and feel the cool waves rub your feet. You can play with sand. There are a couple of shops for refreshments. If you want to reach by bus you can board Pallam bus (bus no.36A) or Ambalapathy bus from Anna Bus Stand, Nagercoil (Nagercoil Town Bus Stand) and get down at Osaravilai which is around 10kms from Anna Bus Stand. From osaravilai you can walk down to the beach which is less than 1km from osaravilai.

sources.snippet: Those who visit the Kanyakumari Beach make it is a point to visit the Kanyakumari Temple and a number of festivals are celebrated here throughout the year, like the Vaishakha, Kalabham and the Navratri. The beaches come alive during these times and devotees come from far and wide to offer their prayers to the deity. Legends say that the Goddess Kumari considered a manifestation of the Goddess Parvati, performed strict penance and meditation on the now named Vivekananda Rock to be united with Lord Shiva.
sources.shortName: Beauty Sightseeing, Shopping & Best Time to Explore

places.name: Kanyakumari beach

reviews.text:
Kanyakumari is a must-visit destination, but timing is key! For a comfortable experience,

plan your visit during the morning or evening when the cool breeze and pleasant weather make sightseeing a delight.

Afternoons can be scorching hot, so it's best to avoid them.

Kanyakumari Beach is one of the best coastal spots with numerous scenic viewpoints, especially for witnessing both sunrise and sunset from different angles. As it's a popular tourist destination, you'll find plenty of small shops catering to visitors, along with a variety of local street food to enjoy.

The presence of the iconic temple at Kanyakumari adds a spiritual charm to your visit, making it even more special. There are also plenty of hotels nearby, many offering beautiful beach views from the rooms.

I'm a frequent traveller and I visit Kanyakumari once every two weeks. The view is mesmerising however there is no proper maintenance. The pictures shared shows the condition of the view points. It's evident that there is no proper maintenance. The Kanyakumari panchayat have increased the entrance ticket charge from 50/- to 100/- and also they are charging additional parking fees. Inspite of collecting these amounts, The Authorities do not provide adequate facilities for tourists. The street sellers are taking advantage and charging more than the required amount for supplies. These suggestions are made so that some improvements will be provided by the Authorities. Whatsoever Kanyakumari is one of the best beaches in Soya India‚ù§Ô∏è

places.address: Vavaturai Beach Rd, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu 629702, India

places.generalDescription: Thengapattanam Beach, situated in Kanyakumari district, is a serene and unspoiled gem that offers a perfect setting for a peaceful retreat. The beach boasts lush coconut groves, tranquil surroundings, and a clean shoreline with gentle waves. It's an ideal spot for nature enthusiasts and photographers seeking picturesque views. Visitors can also witness the traditional coastal lifestyle as local fishermen operate in the area.
places.name: Thengapattanam Beach

reviews.text: This beach offers a unique blend of scenic beauty and vibrant local culture with its bustling fish market. Fresh catches, lively vendors, and ocean views make it a lively spot for seafood lovers and explorers.
Beaches are not kept clean. Not tourist friendly, though the sea view is quite nice.

Beautiful and peaceful beach ‚Äì perfect for families!
A wonderful spot to relax with family. It's clean, less crowded, and offers a calm atmosphere compared to other busy beaches. The sunset view is absolutely stunning ‚Äì a must-see if you're visiting in the evening!

Swimming or playing in the sea is not allowed due to the steep slope and strong currents, but you can still enjoy a peaceful time walking along the shore, taking photos, and enjoying the cool breeze. There are also coconut trees and scenic spots around that make it ideal for a picnic or short visit.

Highly recommended for a quiet family outing or sunset experience!

places.generalDescription: Sanguthurai Beach, located in the southernmost part of India, is a serene and pristine beach with long stretches of white sand. It features a large, ancient conch sculpture from the King Chola-era and offers a tranquil atmosphere for visitors to enjoy sunrise and sunset. The beach is relatively unspoiled and isolated, making it an ideal destination for those seeking peace and quiet.

sources.snippet: For those wishing for some quiet ‚Äòme-time‚Äô, Sanguthurai Beach is the best option in Kanyakumari. Here you can enjoy swimming and watch the waves in loop!. The beach is only nine kilometers from Nagercoil and is the best spot to take your camera out and click some gorgeous pictures.
sources.shortName: Kanyakumari: An incredible beach town in Tamil Nadu

sources.snippet: Sanguthurai Beach is one of Kanyakumari's neatest beaches and is a must-see if you enjoy sunrise and sunset. The white sands of this seaside are particularly eye-catching. This beach appears isolated because it is mostly unspoilt, and you can enjoy your excursion here with family or friends.
sources.shortName: 18 Beautiful Beaches in Tamil Nadu That You Should Visit

places.name: Sanguthurai Beach

reviews.text: It's been taken 2nd place among one of the famous beach in Kanyakumari district. It is a great place to enjoy sun set and to take selfie's, photoshoot (wedding, baby shoot). Nice place to hangout with friends & family on the beach bump. Has various restaurants to have scrumptious foods & snacks.

Sanguthurai Beach is serene, clean, and peaceful, perfect for quiet walks, stunning sunsets, and escaping the tourist crowds.
You can also refresh your mind, when you are there but it is not that much safe for solo female travellers.

A Hidden Gem of Tranquility and Beauty

Sangudhurai Beach is, without a doubt, one of the most enchanting coastal treasures I've had the pleasure of visiting. From the moment you arrive, you're greeted by an atmosphere of serene beauty that instantly melts away any stress.
What truly sets Sangudhurai apart is its pristine and untouched nature. Unlike many overcrowded beaches, Sangudhurai offers ample space to relax, stroll, and simply soak in the breathtaking surroundings. The sand is soft and golden, perfect for leisurely walks, and the clear turquoise waters are incredibly inviting for a refreshing dip.
The natural beauty here is simply stunning. The gentle waves lapping against the shore create a soothing soundtrack, and the picturesque views of the coastline are mesmerizing, especially during sunrise or sunset ‚Äì a photographer's dream! It's a place where you can genuinely connect with nature and find a sense of peace.
While it retains its natural charm, there are just enough amenities (like small local vendors for refreshments) to make your visit comfortable without disrupting the tranquility. The locals are also incredibly friendly and welcoming, adding to the overall positive experience.
Whether you're looking for a peaceful escape, a romantic stroll, or a family outing, Sangudhurai Beach delivers beyond expectations. It's a true hidden gem that deserves all five stars and more. I cannot recommend it highly enough ‚Äì do yourself a favor and experience the magic of Sangudhurai!
